person.persName: George N. Brown (Pike County and Boyd County state legislator and lawyer)

body.p: Born in Huntington, Cabell County, Virginia (now West Virginia), son of Richard Brown and Frances Haney. Graduated Augusta College in Augusta, Kentucky. Admitted to the Kentucky bar in 1844. Practiced law in Pikeville, Kentucky until 1860, when he moved to Catlettsburg, Boyd County, Kentucky. Elected to the Lower House of the Kentucky legislature in 1849, representing Floyd, Pike, and Johnson counties. Elected as a Whig. Became a Democrat in 1855. Attorney for Pike County, Kentucky, 1852-1860.
